title: A Mom Leaves a Baby Group Because of Mean Comments
summary: Martina joined a baby signing class to meet other moms and teach her baby hand signs. But she felt judged by the other mothers. They did not like that she bottle-fed her son and had a C-section birth. Martina thought they saw her as a lazy mom and were competing like teenagers. She left the group after three sessions. Another mom, Ashley Tisdale, also talked about a toxic mom group where some people were left out. A doctor says being a new mom can make women feel insecure and compare themselves to others. Martina had a similar bad experience online when a mom stopped talking to her after learning about her C-section. She knows mom groups can help with loneliness but worries about judgment.

background_read: This article is about mothers who join groups to make friends and get support but sometimes face judgment from other moms. It uses stories from Martina and Ashley Tisdale to show how moms can feel left out or criticized for their choices, like how they feed their babies or give birth. A doctor explains that becoming a mom can be hard and make women feel insecure, leading to mean behavior in groups. The article helps us understand why some moms might leave these groups even though they need help with loneliness.
